page.title: 09Religion
page.content: { Places of worship} There are several places of worship in the area.The 13th century church in Warminghurst presented by the historic churchs trust has 4 services a year and weddings and funerals. The parish church of St.Marys Storrington was mentioned in the original Domesday book and has twice been added to.It contains one fragile brasses.The tower has a peel of six bells.The Alternative prayer book is used for main services. There is a R.C. church,a methodist church,a chapel and a community church which is held at Rydon School.A feature of 1985 has been the development of homegroup meetings of worship and study,prayer breakfasts for the community church and home communion services on St.Marys.All love lively clubs etc attached to them
